abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Bumbuna
            Hydroelectric Environmental and Social Management Project is
            to assist the recipient in satisfactorily addressing and
            mitigating the environmental and social impacts in the
            project area associated with the completion and initial
            operation of the Bumbuna hydroelectric dam and transmission
            line. The restructuring will affect neither project outcomes
            nor project development objectives and the project's
            scope, results framework and outputs will remain unchanged.
            The restructuring is comprised of two changes: a)
            reallocation of additional grant resources of SDR 6.3
            million among different expenditure categories to allow for
            the supply, installation, commissioning and testing of
            sirens, which was not envisaged in 2010; and b) extension of
            the project closing date by nine months from September 30,
            2012, to June 30, 2013 to allow for the remaining activities
            to be completed. Further, the extension of the project
            closing date will also allow the Bank to engage with the
            Government of Sierra Leone to discuss and agree on a
            sustainable mechanism under the broader energy-sector
            dialogue to finance the Bumbuna safety, environmental and
            social management measures.
